ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem Accessing the Heritrix3 from my EC2
ygData.msgSnippet: It s unlikely your problem is Heritrix-specific, as the -b / argument should be sufficient to cause Heritrix to listen on all machine addresses. (If choosing

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem Accessing the Heritrix3 from my EC2
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=BxDJYTYZmc2ammYeSU72xeV8RgPPuuOXgVO5mAYcufPS

It's unlikely your problem is Heritrix-specific, as the '-b /' argument 
should be sufficient to cause Heritrix to listen on all machine 
addresses. (If choosing to be open like that, choosing strong admin 
credentials and monitoring the _out.log for evidence of attempts at 
unauthorized access is all the more important.)

More likely, something specific to the machine or EC2 network 
configuration is the cause.

I suggest eliminating Heritrix from the diagnosis by running something 
else to listen on the test port, and verify connectivity. The tool 
'netcat' (aka 'nc') is helpful for this.

For example, on the ec2 node:

ec2hostname$ echo hello | nc -l -p 9443

 From remote:

$ nc ec2hostname 9443
[type something]

If you see the sent text on each side, TCP connections are working. If 
not, it's not a Heritrix issue.

- Gordon @ IA


On 1/3/11 11:29 PM, yotpo.official wrote:
> Hi I am trying to Access my Heritrix from my local computer.
> I have a problem I can't run Heritrix to open all IP, so The port I want to connect to is open, but I cant access it.
> I am running it with the flag "-b/", what is my problem?
> Thank you
